metadata.title: CVE-2023-24540 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Not all valid JavaScript whitespace characters are considered to be whitespace. Templates containing whitespace characters outside of the character set "\t\n\f\r\u0020\u2028\u2029" in JavaScript contexts that also contain actions may not be properly sanitized during execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.19 - 1.19.2-1ubuntu1.1
golang-1.19-go - 1.19.2-1ubuntu1.1
golang-1.19-src - 1.19.2-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.19 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.19.2-1ubuntu1.1').
